question.title: Will the nationwide #1 party’s vote share in the Netherlands municipal elections be at least 15.0% ?
question.description:
This forecasts how fragmented the national vote is in the 2026 municipal elections, using the top party’s nationwide vote share as a compact measure of concentration.

`{"format":"bot_tournament_question","info":{"hash_id":"1a93d316a0aaadc5","sheet_id":195.1}}`
question.resolution_criteria: This question resolves as “Yes” if the official nationwide results for the [municipal elections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2026_Dutch_municipal_elections) show that the party with the highest nationwide vote share has a vote share ≥ 15.0%, as reported before May 1, 2026. Use the nationwide (landelijk) results table on Verkiezingsuitslagen.nl as the primary source: [https://www.verkiezingsuitslagen.nl/.](https://www.verkiezingsuitslagen.nl/.) The question may also resolve based on [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
question.fine_print:
Question resolves based on the nationwide vote share (percentage of valid votes) for the party ranked #1 nationwide by vote share.

This question resolves based on reporting by Verkiezingsuitslagen.nl. Therefore, parties will be treated exactly as presented by the resolution source and Metaculus will not merge or separate entities beyond what the source presents.

For purposes of this question, "party" refers to an individual national political party or electoral joint list. Thus, aggregated categories that combine the votes of multiple distinct local parties (e.g., *Lokale partijen*) will not be treated as a merged single national party.
question.short_title: Will the #1 vote share in the Dutch municipal elections be at least 15.0% ?
